metadata.title: CVE-2018-18585 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
chmd_read_headers in mspack/chmd.c in libmspack before 0.8alpha accepts afilename that has '\0' as its first or second character (such as the "/\0"name).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmspack0 - 0.9.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmspack package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.1-1').
